content: 1 A pronouncement on Nineveh: The Book of the Prophecy of Nahum the Elkoshite.
content_old: 1 A pronouncement on Nineveh: The Book of the Prophecy of Nahum the Elkoshite.

content: 2 The LORD is a passionate, avenging God; The LORD is vengeful and fierce in wrath. The LORD takes vengeance on His enemies, He rages against His foes.
content_old: 2 The LORD is a passionate, avenging God; The LORD is vengeful and fierce in wrath. The LORD takes vengeance on His enemies, He rages against His foes.

content: 3 The LORD is slow to anger and of great forbearance, But the LORD does not remit all punishment. He travels in whirlwind and storm, And clouds are the dust on His feet.
content_old: 3 The LORD is slow to anger and of great forbearance, But the LORD does not remit all punishment. He travels in whirlwind and storm, And clouds are the dust on His feet.

content: 4 He rebukes the sea and dries it up, And He makes all rivers fail; Bashan and Carmel languish, And the blossoms of Lebanon wither.
content_old: 4 He rebukes the sea and dries it up, And He makes all rivers fail; Bashan and Carmel languish, And the blossoms of Lebanon wither.

content: 5 The mountains quake because of Him, And the hills melt. The earth heaves before Him, The world and all that dwell therein.
content_old: 5 The mountains quake because of Him, And the hills melt. The earth heaves before Him, The world and all that dwell therein.

content: 6 Who can stand before His wrath? Who can resist His fury? His anger pours out like fire, And rocks are shattered because of Him.
content_old: 6 Who can stand before His wrath? Who can resist His fury? His anger pours out like fire, And rocks are shattered because of Him.

content: 7 The LORD is good to those who hope in Him, A haven on a day of distress; He is mindful of those who seek refuge in Him.
content_old: 7 The LORD is good to those who hope in Him, A haven on a day of distress; He is mindful of those who seek refuge in Him.

content: 8 And with a sweeping flood He makes an end of her place, And chases His enemies into darkness.
content_old: 8 And with a sweeping flood He makes an end of her place, And chases His enemies into darkness.

content: 9 Why will you plot against the LORD? He wreaks utter destruction: No adversary opposes Him twice!
content_old: 9 Why will you plot against the LORD? He wreaks utter destruction: No adversary opposes Him twice!

content: 10 For like men besotted with drink, They are burned up like tangled thorns, Like straw that is thoroughly dried.
content_old: 10 For like men besotted with drink, They are burned up like tangled thorns, Like straw that is thoroughly dried.

content: 11 The base plotter Who designed evil against the LORD Has left you.
content_old: 11 The base plotter Who designed evil against the LORD Has left you.

content: 12 Thus said the LORD: “Even as they were full and many, Even so are they over and gone; As surely as I afflicted you, I will afflict you no more.”
content_old: 12 Thus said the LORD: “Even as they were full and many, Even so are they over and gone; As surely as I afflicted you, I will afflict you no more.”

content: 13 And now I will break off his yoke bar from you And burst your cords apart.
content_old: 13 And now I will break off his yoke bar from you And burst your cords apart.

content: 1 Behold on the hills The footsteps of a herald Announcing good fortune! “Celebrate your festivals, O Judah, Fulfill your vows. Never again shall scoundrels invade you, They have totally vanished.”
content_old: 1 Behold on the hills The footsteps of a herald Announcing good fortune! “Celebrate your festivals, O Judah, Fulfill your vows. Never again shall scoundrels invade you, They have totally vanished.”

content: 2 A shatterer has come up against you. Man the guard posts, Watch the road; Steady your loins, Brace all your strength!
content_old: 2 A shatterer has come up against you. Man the guard posts, Watch the road; Steady your loins, Brace all your strength!

content: 3 For the LORD has restored the Pride of Jacob As well as the Pride of Israel, Though marauders have laid them waste And ravaged their branches.
content_old: 3 For the LORD has restored the Pride of Jacob As well as the Pride of Israel, Though marauders have laid them waste And ravaged their branches.

content: 4 His warriors’ shields are painted red, And the soldiers are clothed in crimson; The chariots are like flaming torches, On the day they are made ready. The arrows of cypress wood are poisoned,
content_old: 4 His warriors’ shields are painted red, And the soldiers are clothed in crimson; The chariots are like flaming torches, On the day they are made ready. The arrows of cypress wood are poisoned,

content: 5 The chariots dash about frenzied in the fields, They rush through the meadows. They appear like torches, They race like streaks of lightning.
content_old: 5 The chariots dash about frenzied in the fields, They rush through the meadows. They appear like torches, They race like streaks of lightning.

content: 6 He commands his burly men; They stumble as they advance, They hasten up to her wall, Where wheeled shelters are set up.
content_old: 6 He commands his burly men; They stumble as they advance, They hasten up to her wall, Where wheeled shelters are set up.

content: 7 The floodgates are opened, And the palace is deluged.
content_old: 7 The floodgates are opened, And the palace is deluged.

content: 8 And Huzzab is exiled and carried away, While her handmaidens escort her As with the voices of doves, Beating their breasts.
content_old: 8 And Huzzab is exiled and carried away, While her handmaidens escort her As with the voices of doves, Beating their breasts.

content: 9 Nineveh has been like a pool of water From earliest times; Now they flee. “Stop! Stop!”— But none can turn them back.
content_old: 9 Nineveh has been like a pool of water From earliest times; Now they flee. “Stop! Stop!”— But none can turn them back.

content: 10 “Plunder silver! Plunder gold!” There is no limit to the treasure; It is a hoard of all precious objects.
content_old: 10 “Plunder silver! Plunder gold!” There is no limit to the treasure; It is a hoard of all precious objects.

content: 11 Desolation, devastation, and destruction! Spirits sink, Knees buckle, All loins tremble, All faces turn ashen.
content_old: 11 Desolation, devastation, and destruction! Spirits sink, Knees buckle, All loins tremble, All faces turn ashen.

content: 12 What has become of that lions’ den, That pasture of great beasts, Where lion and lion’s breed walked, And lion’s cub—with none to disturb them?
content_old: 12 What has become of that lions’ den, That pasture of great beasts, Where lion and lion’s breed walked, And lion’s cub—with none to disturb them?

content: 13 the lion that tore victims for his cubs And strangled for his lionesses, And filled his lairs with prey And his dens with mangled flesh?
content_old: 13 the lion that tore victims for his cubs And strangled for his lionesses, And filled his lairs with prey And his dens with mangled flesh?

content: 1 Ah, city of crime, Utterly treacherous, Full of violence, Where killing never stops!
content_old: 1 Ah, city of crime, Utterly treacherous, Full of violence, Where killing never stops!

content: 2 Crack of whip And rattle of wheel, Galloping steed And bounding chariot!
content_old: 2 Crack of whip And rattle of wheel, Galloping steed And bounding chariot!

content: 3 Charging horsemen, Flashing swords, And glittering spears! Hosts of slain And heaps of corpses, Dead bodies without number— They stumble over bodies.
content_old: 3 Charging horsemen, Flashing swords, And glittering spears! Hosts of slain And heaps of corpses, Dead bodies without number— They stumble over bodies.

content: 4 Because of the countless harlotries of the harlot, The winsome mistress of sorcery, Who ensnared nations with her harlotries And peoples with her sorcery,
content_old: 4 Because of the countless harlotries of the harlot, The winsome mistress of sorcery, Who ensnared nations with her harlotries And peoples with her sorcery,

content: 5 I am going to deal with you —declares the LORD of Hosts. I will lift up your skirts over your face And display your nakedness to the nations And your shame to kingdoms.
content_old: 5 I am going to deal with you —declares the LORD of Hosts. I will lift up your skirts over your face And display your nakedness to the nations And your shame to kingdoms.

content: 6 I will throw loathsome things over you And disfigure you And make a spectacle of you.
content_old: 6 I will throw loathsome things over you And disfigure you And make a spectacle of you.

content: 7 All who see you will recoil from you And will say, “Nineveh has been ravaged!” Who will console her? Where shall I look for Anyone to comfort you?
content_old: 7 All who see you will recoil from you And will say, “Nineveh has been ravaged!” Who will console her? Where shall I look for Anyone to comfort you?

content: 8 Were you any better than No-amon, Which sat by the Nile, Surrounded by water— Its rampart a river, Its wall consisting of sea?
content_old: 8 Were you any better than No-amon, Which sat by the Nile, Surrounded by water— Its rampart a river, Its wall consisting of sea?

content: 9 Populous Nubia And teeming Egypt, Put and the Libyans— They were her helpers.
content_old: 9 Populous Nubia And teeming Egypt, Put and the Libyans— They were her helpers.

content: 10 Yet even she was exiled, She went into captivity. Her babes, too, were dashed in pieces At every street corner. Lots were cast for her honored men, And all her nobles were bound in chains.
content_old: 10 Yet even she was exiled, She went into captivity. Her babes, too, were dashed in pieces At every street corner. Lots were cast for her honored men, And all her nobles were bound in chains.

content: 11 You too shall be drunk And utterly overcome; You too shall seek A refuge from the enemy.
content_old: 11 You too shall be drunk And utterly overcome; You too shall seek A refuge from the enemy.

content: 12 All your forts are fig trees With ripe fruit; If shaken they will fall Into the mouths of devourers.
content_old: 12 All your forts are fig trees With ripe fruit; If shaken they will fall Into the mouths of devourers.

content: 13 Truly, the troops within you are women; The gates of your land have opened themselves To your enemies; Fire has consumed your gate bars.
content_old: 13 Truly, the troops within you are women; The gates of your land have opened themselves To your enemies; Fire has consumed your gate bars.

content: 14 Draw water for the siege, Strengthen your forts; Tread the clay, Trample the mud, Grasp the brick mold!
content_old: 14 Draw water for the siege, Strengthen your forts; Tread the clay, Trample the mud, Grasp the brick mold!

content: 15 There fire will devour you, The sword will put an end to you; It will devour you like the grub. Multiply like grubs, Multiply like locusts!
content_old: 15 There fire will devour you, The sword will put an end to you; It will devour you like the grub. Multiply like grubs, Multiply like locusts!

content: 16 You had more traders Than the sky has stars— The grubs cast their skins and fly away.
content_old: 16 You had more traders Than the sky has stars— The grubs cast their skins and fly away.

content: 17 Your guards were like locusts, Your marshals like piles of hoppers Which settle on the stone fences On a chilly day; When the sun comes out, they fly away, And where they are nobody knows.
content_old: 17 Your guards were like locusts, Your marshals like piles of hoppers Which settle on the stone fences On a chilly day; When the sun comes out, they fly away, And where they are nobody knows.

content: 18 Your shepherds are slumbering, O king of Assyria; Your sheepmasters are lying inert; Your people are scattered over the hills, And there is none to gather them.
content_old: 18 Your shepherds are slumbering, O king of Assyria; Your sheepmasters are lying inert; Your people are scattered over the hills, And there is none to gather them.
